This option specifies a resource string to be used. This is especially useful for

Explanations about Options.-ls:
This option indicates that the shell that is started in the xterm window will be a
 login shell (i.e., the first character of argv[0] will be a dash, indicating to

au_757566: What are these extra output lines in bash?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_757566: # Here I'm launching three 'echo' commands, the first two in background, the third in foreground
andrea@andrea-laptop:~$ echo first & echo second & echo third
[1] 5033    # This is bash telling me that the first process was started with job number 1 and PID 5033
first       # This is the output from the first process
[2] 5034    # This is bash telling me that the second process was started with job number 2 and PID 5034
third       # This is the output from the third process
second      # This is the output from the second process
andrea@andrea-laptop:~$ 
[1]-  Done                    echo first    # This is bash telling me that the first background job has quit
[2]+  Done                    echo second   # This is bash telling me that the second background job has quit

Answers.MP Summary: or  any situation  where  you want to make sure you're doing a clean install of your dependencies. It  can  be  significantly  faster  than  a  regular  npm  install  by  skipping   certain user-oriented  features.  It  is  also  more strict than a regular install, which can help catch errors or inconsistencies caused by the incrementally-installed  local  environments of most npm users. In short, the main differences between using npm install and npm ci are: · The project must have an existing package-lock.json or npm-shrinkwrap.json. · If dependencies in the package lock do not match those in package.json, npm ci will exit with an error, instead of updating the package lock. · npm ci can only install entire projects at a time:  individual  dependencies  cannot  be added with this command. · If  a  node_modules  is  already present, it will be automatically removed before npm ci begins its install. · It will  never  write  to  package.json  or  any  of  the  package-locks:  installs  are essentially frozen. See Also · npm help install · npm help package-locks April 2020                                  NPM-CI(1)

Explanations about Options.-x:
Treat unknown capabilities as user-defined (see user_caps(5)). That is, if you
 supply a capability name which tic does not recognize, it will infer its type
 (boolean, number or string) from the syntax and make an extended table entry for
 that. User-defined capability strings whose name begins with “k” are treated as
